Diagnosis
	1. Squamous cell carcinoma of mid-esophagus T3N2M0

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	Not indicated at present

	Radiotherapy
	Planned following completion of systemic therapy

	Chemotherapy
	Cycle 3/6 of cisplatin/5FU completed 15 April 2024

	Clinical studies
	Enrolled in SCOPE-2 trial (randomised to standard dose radiotherapy arm)

	Current disease status
	Stable disease on interim CT assessment

	Current issues
	Mild dysphagia to solids only

	Summary of consultation
	This 62-year-old gentleman is participating in the SCOPE-2 trial for locally advanced esophageal cancer. He has completed three cycles of induction chemotherapy with cisplatin and 5-fluorouracil. The interim CT scan performed on 10/04/24 shows stable disease with reduction in the circumferential thickening of the mid-esophagus from 18mm to 12mm. The previously noted mediastinal nodes have also decreased in size.

He has tolerated the treatment well with only grade 1 nausea and mild fatigue. His dysphagia has improved since starting treatment and he is now able to manage a soft diet with occasional need for liquid supplements.

Blood tests today show stable renal function with creatinine clearance >60ml/min and satisfactory hematological parameters for cycle 4.

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT planned after completion of chemotherapy prior to radiotherapy phase

	Medication prescribed
	Continuing with standard antiemetic protocol

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks for cycle 4
Trial coordinator review scheduled for next week

	Required GP actions
	None required at present

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Discussed interim scan results showing good disease response. Explained plan to complete three further cycles of chemotherapy followed by radiotherapy phase as per trial protocol.
